data.title: VS .mgcb handling needs extra features
data.body:
1. If you delete the default Content folder from the template you get errors.
2. If you add additional .mgcb files to the project (even in the Content folder) they do not build

We would like an mgcb file to be built no matter where it is in the project but it would be acceptable to require a Content folder if that's a problem.

In addition out content folders are outside the main project directory as they are shared between multiple projects. We add the .mgcb files using 'link'

data.title: iOS .m4a song files load exception
data.body: On previous projects I have loaded songs as raw .m4a files without using the content pipeline since .mp3 has a hefty license cost. A few days ago I updated to the latest MonoGame build from Github and since then I get an exception on loading any .m4a song files "cannot load non-content file" even though the songs are set to 'Content' and 'Output always'. How can I fix this?

data.title: Trigger selection event when left/right arrow keys are used in the UI.
data.body:
This fixes issue #3256.

I was thinking about manually calling this event in the ... if ( e.KeyCode == Keys.Left/Right ) parts of OnKeyDown, but it seems like this should be called every time SelectSingleNode is called. Let me know what to fix/change if needed.

data.title: Pipeline tool doesn't always update the properties pane when the left/right arrow keys are pressed
data.body:
To reproduce this:
1. In the Pipeline tool, create a folder with some piece of content inside it.
2. Click the content - notice that the property pane updates to show the content's properties.
3. Press the left arrow key to navigate from the content to its parent folder. Notice that the properties pane still shows the content's properties rather than the folder's properties.
4. Keep pressing the left arrow key - the properties pane still shows the content's properties, rather than the folder/project's properties.

The above behavior also happens for the right arrow key.

data.title: Made the retry a little smarter when MediaFactory.GetService fails.
data.body: Fixes #2620.

data.title: Window Height Stuck at 800 px [Linux]
data.body:
Hey all,
When working on one of my projects using the stable version of MonoGame, I noticed that the window was stuck at the default OpenTK game window size, 640x480 I believe. I fixed this by updating to the develop3d branch of Monogame and the version of OpenTK packaged within the git submodules. Any idea why this is happening or what I could try to fix it? I can build the Monogame.Framework.Linux projects fine, which is where I am getting the Monogame dlls, so I can try out any changes if need be.

OS: Arch Linux
CPU: Manufacturer: AMD
GPU Manufacturer: AMD

data.title: Updated NuGet package definitions
data.body:
Updated DLL's to the 10th December 2014 commit for both base and Networking deliverables
Included the new Windows Phone 8.1 project template 

Also updated Game.cs example to the new one included with WP8.1 (Spinning cube)

Also updated icon for package to latest

data.title: Thoughts on a MG Content Builder NuGet
data.body:
With the upcoming release of the updated NuGet's, I'm guessing people will want an easier access to the new MGCB tool.

before I commit to putting it together, what are everyone's thoughts about shipping the MGCB tool as a NuGet?

That way it can be updated outside of the main MSI installer.

data.title: Content Builder tool opens last project when double clicking on a .mgcb file
data.body:
An annoyance more than anything but something that could severely trouble beginners with multiple projects

If you double click on a .mgcb file in windows it opens the Content Builder tool

However it doesn't open the one that was clicked, instead it reopens the last one that was open!!

data.title: Added .NET solution for the WindowsPhone 8.1 platform
data.body: Added the .NET project for the Windows Phone 8.1 solution

data.title: Fix Icon Backgrounds On Windows 8
data.body:
On Windows 8 the icons for MonoGame URL links end up with a pretty poor background color choice...

![tiles](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/103522/5363047/20b87da0-7f9e-11e4-87c2-69553221e85e.png)

I came across this article...

 http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/dn393983.aspx

... but I haven't figured out how to make this apply to .url files.

data.title: Templates and Protobuild Fixes
data.body:
This PR has the latest Protobuild.exe fixing store certification for WP8.1 projects and support for ConfigurationMapping entries.

It also makes the `<MonoGameContentBuilderExe>` path overloadable from a game's csproj file.

Finally I fixed the manifest for the WP8.1 template to correctly use template parameters.

Fixes #3237.
Fixes #3146.

data.title: Small Doc Update
data.body: Added a tutorial link (as suggested by @theZMan)  also fixed up the `Documentation/README.md` to explain how to edit documentation right from the web browser without ever needing to leave the GitHub site.

data.title: Fix For Android Linking
data.body:
This PR changes the Protobuild definition for the MonoGame.Framework.Net library to have it build into its own folder.  This resolves https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/2981 by ensuring the extra Android stuff doesn't get clobbered.

Fixes #2981

data.title: check  if graphicsDevice._d3dDevice.NativePointer == null
data.body:
fix for issue #3206.
When WP8 resume an WindowsPhoneGameWindow.Page_OrientationChanged event
might occur too early before the device gets updated. In that case
graphicsDevice._d3dDevice.NativePointer is null and
graphicsDevice._d3dDevice.FeatureLevel fails.

I moved outside the try/catch block to make the code readable and to
handle all possible sources of exceptions.

data.title: Add code to disable the "Open Recent" menu in Pipeline.exe if it contains 0 items.
data.body: This is a fix for issue #3122.

data.title: Ambiguous terminology. Pipeline.exe, .mgcb, mgcb.exe
data.body:
Our terminology is very awkward and ambiguous...
1. pipeline - am i referring to the monogame pipeline as a conceptual whole? am i referring to the pipeline executable? Or maybe the monogame.framework.content.pipeline assembly?
2. mgcb - am i referring to the executable or the file extension?

Proposal:
I think that mgcb.exe needs to be renamed, the mgcb file extension should be changed, and pipeline.exe should be renamed. 

The specific names are not important but if it were up to me maybe the following:

rename mgcb.exe to mgbuild.exe - a'la msbuild.exe
rename pipeline.exe to mgbuild-gui.exe
change the .mgcb file extension to mgcontent - a'la XNA's .contentproj

data.title: The Type exists in both XNA and MG with Windows Phone 8.1
data.body:
This one is driving me up the wall, so crying out for help.  Hopefully @tomspilman or @hach-que has an answer

Sorting out the protobuild config to generate the .NET project for WP81 which is created fine.

However when I try to built it I get numerous errors like the following:
The type 'Microsoft.Xna.Framework.PlayerIndex' exists in both 'MonoGame.Framework\bin\WindowsPhone81\AnyCPU\Debug\MonoGame.Framework.dll' and '\Microsoft\Framework\WindowsPhone\v8.1\Microsoft.Xna.Framework.dll'  

But I can find no reference to the XNA libs anywhere in the WP81 projects.

Was there some funky configuration required for the WP81 protobuild config I'm missing?

data.title: Do we have any docs on shipping/redist of MonoGame
data.body:
As I created https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/3240 it crossed my mind that I've not seen any documents on shipping a game on Steam or with an installer (or on other platforms).

What do you need to include? How to bootstrap an installer to put all the right runtimes on a machine. the only installer I know of is the one that installs all the runtime AND all the VS dependencies which is probably overkill and since it has UI no applicable for games.

Any thoughts? Note that steam will (in theory) install .Net (though what version) and XNA for you if you use those - but MonoGame is not one of its default runtimes so a game on steam would have to do that.

Installers was a huge problem in the XNA forums and most people were shipping in Xbox where they didn't have to worry. So this is possibly a barrier for people shipping MonoGame games.

data.title: Missing XINput.dll on clean machine
data.body:
Tom and I installed MonoGame on a totally clean windows installation for the MVA video.

The desktop template doesn't work because any reference to the GamePad API throws this error
"xinput1_3.dll not found". We're not the only one to notice it was mentioned in this article too http://www.codemag.com/Article/1411081

XInput is not a part of the default DirectX install so it doesn't ship with windows. You need to run the DirectX web installer to fix it http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=35 (or install XNA which is why most of us never see the error). We did note that the windows store template does not suffer from this issue suggesting that the GamePad API is not wrapping XInput on windows store apps.

Solution: The MonoGame installer should use DirectX setup to make sure that XInput1_3.dll (and any other optional DX components) are installed. 

Or maybe SharpDX needs to link to a later version? Chucks block talks about a 1_4 and a 9_1 version on windows 8 http://blogs.msdn.com/b/chuckw/archive/2012/04/26/xinput-and-windows-8-consumer-preview.aspx

data.title: Plt window title
data.body:
Changed the window title from `"MonoGame Pipeline"` to instead show the `Application.ExecutablePath`.
This allows you to quickly identify which version of the pipeline tool you are looking at for people who regularly work with more than one version of monogame (eg, project1/monogame, project2/monogame). > Oops I just tried to build project1's content with project2's monogame...

The various pipeline.exe windows are otherwise/currently identical.

data.title: MonoGameContentBuilderExe should be defined in the project not in the targets file
data.body:
Concerning this line in MonoGame.Content.Builder.targets

``` xml
<MonoGameContentBuilderExe>$(MSBuildExtensionsPath)\MonoGame\v3.0\Tools\MGCB.exe</MonoGameContentBuilderExe>
```

This variable should really be defined by the csproj not the targets file: allowing different projects to be build by different versions of monogame, if an advanced user wishes to hand edit their csproj.

data.title: Template projects should reference .targets through installed environmental var
data.body:
Concerning this line (present in all our template projects)...
`<Import Project="$(MSBuildExtensionsPath)\MonoGame\v3.0\MonoGame.Content.Builder.targets" />`

I propose that it be changed to something like...
`<Import Project="$(MonoGameDir)\MonoGame\v3.0\MonoGame.Content.Builder.targets" />`

Where $(MonoGameDir) is a system level environmental variable which is set by the installer. The purpose of this change is to allow more flexibility for users who are working with monogame source code and/or have more than one version of monogame used by different projects.

data.title: Added vs2013 template for 'windows desktop' games.
data.body: This is a direct copy, unmodified, from ProjectTemplates/VisualStudio2010/Windows - however I did verify that it works within vs2013.

data.title: Better error when VertexFormat doesn't match shader
data.body:
During MVA demo had a cased where a models vertex format mismatched with the shader input format.

The error you get is below. @tomspilman says he can make that better.

An unhandled exception of type 'SharpDX.SharpDXException' occurred in SharpDX.dll

Additional information: HRESULT: [0x80070057], Module: [General], ApiCode: [E_INVALIDARG/Invalid Arguments], Message: The parameter is incorrect.

data.title: Android Song custom file support (none assets)
Reference OpenTK as NuGet package?
data.body:
I've discovered, that when you clone the project, run the Protobuild and then open & build the `MonoGame.Framework.Linux` solution file, build fails, as OpenTK reference is missing.

Could it be added as a NuGet package dependency? I believe that using dependency manager will ease the development (so that solution can be built out of the box).

data.title: Added TimeSpanSerializer.cs
data.body: IntermediateSerializer can now handle the type TimeSpan.

data.title: Make Gui Tool fonts/ui scale
data.body:
When doing the MVA webcast we noticed that the GUI tool doesn't scale. Can we make it honor DPI settings or have a font size in the settings. On retina type displays this is probably a problem too. 

Sure you can use ZoomIt but this would be nice too

data.title: double click mgdb from VS sometimes opens wrong file
data.body:
Sometimes the GUI tool opens the most recent mgcb not the one you double clicked on

In my case it was a brand new DX Windows project.
